name: I'm Dead to You Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: My wife and I died when our boat was destroyed during a storm. We left our two daughters behind to rule the kingdom of Arendelle. What movie are we from?
questions.explanation:
Frozen.

	The King and Queen of Arendelle were in the 2013 Disney movie "Frozen". After realizing that Elsa's ice powers were a danger to everyone, the King and Queen had the castle shut down for 13 years. On a trip overseas, Elsa and Anna's parents were killed in a storm. The castle was opened once again when it was time for Elsa's coronation.

questions.text: My name is Shelby and I'm from "Steel Magnolias". Even after my mother donated one of her kidneys to me, I died a few days after Halloween. Complications from what disease claimed my life?
questions.explanation:
Diabetes.

	Shelby (Julia Roberts) lost her life to complications caused by diabetes a few days after Halloween. Her mother (Sally Field) donated a kidney after Shelby's pregnancy caused strain on her kidneys, but months after the operation Shelby collapsed and she was taken off life support.

questions.text: I didn't see my death coming. Seriously, I didn't see my death coming. I was busy giving a speech to my co-workers about how we needed to stick together and then a shark ate me. What was my name in "Deep Blue Sea"?
questions.explanation:
Russell Franklin.

	Russell Franklin (Samuel L. Jackson) was a corporate executive for Aquatica. He was sent to investigate the death of a group of teenagers by a shark that escaped Aquatica. When the rest of the sharks got loose, the trapped members of Aquatica raced to escape the deadly sharks. While giving a speech about how they had to stay together to be safe, a shark jumped up from behind Russell Franklin and ate him.

questions.text: My name is Bodhi and I am from "Point Break". I was going to be carted off to prison for committing bank robberies, but an FBI agent let me take my surfboard out to catch one more wave. Unfortunately, I never came back. Who played me?
questions.explanation:
Patrick Swayze.

	Bodhi was the head of a gang of surfers that robbed banks and called themselves the ex-presidents due to the masks they wore when they committed the robberies. Agent Johnny Utah was sent undercover to infiltrate the group and stop the robberies. Bodhi and his friends escaped, but Johnny found Bodhi nine months later in Australia waiting for the perfect wave. Johnny let Bodhi surf his last wave and walked away when Bodhi never returned from the ocean.  Patrick Swayze is best known as Johnny in "Dirty Dancing". In the beginning of his career, Patrick Swayze guest starred on an episode of "M*A*S*H" titled "Blood Brothers".

questions.text: I died a hero while trying to kill a Norse god in "The Avengers". Unfortunately, he killed me, but in the end I was avenged. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Phil Coulson.

	Phil Coulson came into the Marvel world in "Iron Man". He was Nick Fury's go-to guy when it came to the Avengers. While trying to capture Loki after he escaped the prison pod, Loki killed Coulson by stabbing him. The Avengers avenged Coulson's death by capturing Loki. A few months later, a resurrected Phil Coulson returned to SHIELD to head a new team of heroes. It was explained in the first season of the TV show that after Coulson died, Nick Fury had him resurrected using a medical procedure created for a dead Avenger.

questions.text: My name is Willa Harper. When my husband died in prison, I remarried a supposed preacher who later slit my throat and dumped me in the river. He got his in the end though when he was shot and subsequently arrested for trying to kill my children. Who played me in "The Night of the Hunter"?
questions.explanation:
Shelley Winters.

	Harry Powell (Robert Mitchum) killed his wife Willa Harper (Shelley Winters) like he had done to his previous wives. He then dumped her body in the river and went after her children, who knew the whereabouts of stolen money hidden in Pearl's doll. Rachel Cooper (Lillian Gish) kept the children safe and eventually had Harry Powell arrested. The children remained with her.  Shelley Winters had many uncredited roles before her 1948 credited role in "Larceny" as a crook in love with a con man. She won a Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her role in "The Diary of Anne Frank" (1959).

questions.text: My name is Casey Becker from "Scream" and my death began one of the greatest horror sagas of the late '90s. Do me a favor, when you get a phone call asking what your favorite scary movie is, answer correctly. Who played Casey Becker?
questions.explanation:
Drew Barrymore.

	Casey Becker was home alone popping popcorn when a mysterious stranger called the house asking for her favorite scary movie. When she didn't answer correctly, the mysterious stranger killed her boyfriend and then killed Casey. Casey's parents arrived home to find their daughter hanging from a tree.  Drew Barrymore accepted the role of Sydney Prescott for "Scream", but when her scheduled dictated that she bow out of the role, Drew accepted the very small role of Casey Becker and opened the movie with her character's death.

questions.text: All Marion wanted was to steal enough money so that she and her boyfriend could live happily together. What Marion didn't expect was to end up dead in her motel room shower. What Alfred Hitchcock movie contained this iconic scene?
questions.explanation:
Psycho.

	Hitchcock's shower scene lasted three minutes and took 50 different scene cuts to get right. Chocolate syrup was used for Marion's blood. To get the sucking sound of a knife entering and exiting flesh, a knife was thrust in and out of a melon. This moment is known as the most pivotal scene in the 1960 classic "Psycho".

questions.text: Harry Stamper died a heroic death when he sacrificed his own life to split a large asteroid on a direct course with Earth. Before detonating the nuclear bomb that would split the asteroid, Harry contacted his daughter on Earth and said his last goodbye. What movie contained this emotional death scene?
questions.explanation:
Armageddon.

	Harry Stamper (Bruce Willis) and several of his co-workers were hired by NASA to blow up an asteroid on a collision course with Earth. Harry used his men and several of NASA's men to go into space for the asteroid. When the automatic controls were damaged, it was revealed that someone had to manually blow the bomb that would split the asteroid. A.J. (Ben Affleck) drew the short straw and prepared to manually blow the bomb. At the last moment, Harry prevented him from going out and completed the mission on his own, killing him instantly.

questions.text: Lieutenant Matt Kowalski died in space by detaching the tether that joined him and Dr. Ryan Stone. By doing this, Lieutenant Kowalski floated into space until Doctor Stone lost track of him. In what movie did this unusual death scene occur?
questions.explanation:
Gravity.

	Lieutenant Matt Kowalski (George Clooney) and Dr. Ryan Stone (Sandra Bullock) were in space on their last and and first trip in space, respectively, to perform maintenance on the Hubble Space Telescope when debris striked their spacecraft knocking Ryan into space. Lieutenant Kowalski rescueds her, but detached them since only one of them could survive with the remaining air they had left. Ryan rescued herself and Lieutenant Matt Kowalski was seen again in her dreams as he explained to her how to get back to Earth.
